text: The Gulfport-Biloxi Metropolitan Statistical Area is a metropolitan area in the Mississippi Gulf Coast region that covers four counties â€“ Hancock, Harrison, Jackson, and Stone. At the 2023 estimate, its population was 421,916. At the 2000 census, the MSA had a population of 246,190. The area was significantly impacted by Hurricane Katrina in 2005. A July 1, 2006, estimate placed the population at 227,904. Prior to the hurricane, the area had experienced steady to moderate population growth. It is also part of the larger Gulfport-Biloxi-Pascagoula Combined Statistical Area. ==References== Category:Geography of Mississippi Category:Metropolitan areas of the United States
title: Gulfport-Biloxi metropolitan area
